patterns: Can I have some information about anxiety?
How do I support a loved one with anxiety?
How do I fix my anxiety?
responses: Anxiety is your body's natural response to stress. It's a feeling of fear or apprehension about what's to come. Don't worry, it can be totally normal for stressful situations like a date or before a test! Some common symptoms are excessive worry, hyperventilation, sweating, and others. We all get anxious sometimes, but anxiety becomes a problem when it starts affecting your daily life drastically. The best thing that you can do to help reduce anxiety is to take a few deep breaths and talk to someone about what you're feeling. Some natural remedies that you can try include: getting enough sleep meditating, staying active and exercising, eating a healthy diet, staying active and working out, avoiding alcohol, avoiding caffeine, and quitting smoking cigarettes. Support your friends and loved ones by checking up on them and just listening. Whatever you're feeling is valid.

patterns: I feel sad all the time
Can I have some information about depression?
How do I support a loved one with depression?
How do I fix my depression?
responses: So sorry to hear that. Depression is a mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest. Also called major depressive disorder or clinical depression, it affects how you feel, think and behave and can lead to a variety of emotional and physical problems. You may have trouble doing normal day-to-day activities, and sometimes you may feel as if life isn't worth living, which if that's the case, you should talk to someone who can help at 800-273-8255 immediately. A few tips that have worked for others are doing rewarding tasks. Things like exercising for a little bit a day, playing a musical instrument, even something as simple as taking a warm shower can all boost your mood. The first steps might be hard, but your body will reward you for it soon enough! Remember, it's totally okay and normal to feel like this! The important thing is to treat it as soon as you can!

patterns: Can I have some information about schizophrenia?
How do I support a loved one with schizophrenia?
How do I fix my schizophrenia?
responses: I see that you want to learn more about schizophrenia, and how to support yourself or your loved ones. Schizophrenia is a serious mental disorder in which people interpret reality abnormally. Schizophrenia may result in some combination of hallucinations, delusions, and extremely disordered thinking and behavior that impairs daily functioning, and can be disabling. People with schizophrenia require lifelong treatment. Early treatment may help get symptoms under control before serious complications develop and may help improve the long-term outlook. If you believe you have symptoms of schizophrenia, and/or you have various risk factors that increase the likelihood of schizophrenia, please consult a family doctor and/or psychiatrist for a diagnosis and treatment plan specific for the individual.

responses: Some days we all have those feelings. It's totally normal, and feeling unmotivated can be reversed! Some steps we recommend are to start small. Setting small, achievable, and realistic goals can help you keep track of your progress. Start small, then you can work your way up. Any progress, even if minimal, is still a step forward and you should be proud!

Ah, it's common to feel like that. If you ever feel like you aren't good enough, or that maybe you don't have a purpose, try to journal down some thoughts in our journal section. While you journal, try to reflect on what you are grateful for, the people you love, and your interests. Hopefully, you can get a boost from knowing what you're doing, why, and for who. If not, feel free to take a break and come back later! Virma is always here for you!
